summary: You wouldn't embark on a major car repair without a manual and knowledge of how the car is put together. Similarly, DOD can't maintain its weapon systems without intellectual property (IP)—technical data, user manuals, and more—from the contractors who develop them. DOD also needs the data rights to use or distribute this IP. However, DOD weapon program staff don't always properly plan to get and...
title: Weapon System Sustainment: DOD Can Improve Planning and Management of Data Rights [Reissued with revisions on Sep. 29, 2025]
